       7             : /**
       8             :  * A common base class for representing WebIDL callback function and
       9             :  * callback interface types in C++.
      10             :  *
      11             :  * This class implements common functionality like lifetime
      12             :  * management, initialization with the JS object, and setup of the
      13             :  * call environment.  Subclasses are responsible for providing methods
      14             :  * that do the call into JS as needed.
      15             :  */

      51             :   // The caller may pass a global object which will act as an override for the
      52             :   // incumbent script settings object when the callback is invoked (overriding
      53             :   // the entry point computed from aCallback). If no override is required, the
      54             :   // caller should pass null.  |aCx| is used to capture the current
      55             :   // stack, which is later used as an async parent when the callback
      56             :   // is invoked.  aCx can be nullptr, in which case no stack is
      57             :   // captured.

      82             :   // This is guaranteed to be non-null from the time the CallbackObject is
      83             :   // created until JavaScript has had a chance to run. It will only return null
      84             :   // after a JavaScript caller has called nukeSandbox on a Sandbox object, and
      85             :   // the cycle collector has had a chance to run.
      86             :   //
      87             :   // This means that any native callee which receives a CallbackObject as an
      88             :   // argument can safely rely on the callback being non-null so long as it
      89             :   // doesn't trigger any scripts before it accesses it.
      90             :   JS::Handle<JSObject*> CallbackOrNull() const

     569             : 
     570             : // T is expected to be a RefPtr or OwningNonNull around a CallbackObject
     571             : // subclass.  This class is used in bindings to safely handle Fast* callbacks;
     572             : // it ensures that the callback is traced, and that if something is holding onto
     573             : // the callback when we're done with it HoldJSObjects is called.
     574             : template<typename T>
     575             : class MOZ_RAII RootedCallback : public JS::Rooted<T>
     576             : {
     577             : public:
     578         240 :   explicit RootedCallback(JSContext* cx)
     579             :     : JS::Rooted<T>(cx)
     580         240 :     , mCx(cx)
     581         240 :   {}
     582             : 
     583             :   // We need a way to make assignment from pointers (how we're normally used)
     584             :   // work.
     585             :   template<typename S>
     586             :   void operator=(S* arg)
     587             :   {
     588         480 :     this->get().operator=(arg);
     589             :   }
     590             : 
     591             :   // But nullptr can't use the above template, because it doesn't know which S
     592             :   // to select.  So we need a special overload for nullptr.
     593             :   void operator=(decltype(nullptr) arg)
     594             :   {
     595           0 :     this->get().operator=(arg);
     596             :   }
     597             : 
     598             :   // Codegen relies on being able to do CallbackOrNull() on us.
     599             :   JS::Handle<JSObject*> CallbackOrNull() const
     600             :   {
     601             :     return this->get()->CallbackOrNull();
     602             :   }
     603             : 
     604         240 :   ~RootedCallback()
     605             :   {
     606             :     // Ensure that our callback starts holding on to its own JS objects as
     607             :     // needed.  We really do need to check that things are initialized even when
     608             :     // T is OwningNonNull, because we might be running before the OwningNonNull
     609             :     // ever got assigned to!
     610         720 :     if (IsInitialized(this->get())) {
     611         720 :       this->get()->FinishSlowJSInitIfMoreThanOneOwner(mCx);
     612             :     }
     613         240 :   }
     614             : 
     615             : private:
     616             :   template<typename U>
     617             :   static bool IsInitialized(U& aArg); // Not implemented
     618             : 
     619             :   template<typename U>
     620             :   static bool IsInitialized(RefPtr<U>& aRefPtr)
     621             :   {
     622             :     return aRefPtr;
     623             :   }
     624             : 
     625             :   template<typename U>
     626             :   static bool IsInitialized(OwningNonNull<U>& aOwningNonNull)
     627             :   {
     628             :     return aOwningNonNull.isInitialized();
     629             :   }
     630             : 
     631             :   JSContext* mCx;
